Package HCP.Communication

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
HCP.Communication.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientHandler extends Thread
Class responsible for handling a client socket connection and communicates with the CCP GUI

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler(Socket s, DataInputStream dis, DataOutputStream dos) throws InterruptedException
      Initializes all the variables. Starts the logger and the HCP GUI
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Loads the HCP GUI and its default configurations

    • run

      public void run()
      Thread run implementation

      Receives every message from the client and uses the handleRequest function to produce an action

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • handleRequest

      private Response handleRequest(String received) throws IOException
      Handles all the messages received from the client socket

      Each message can be split by the character ':'. The first object of the splitten array indicates the action to take place

      Example START:NoS$4|NoA$4|NoC$6|... indicates to start the simulation and the rest of the message indicates the settings of the simulation

      Parameters:
      received - : the message received from the client
      Returns:
      Response object according to the action taken
      Throws:
      IOException
